channel.title: Wont Run
channel.description:
[b]Please move to client help[/b]
My client wont run, I use windows 7. And Its not working.
heres whats in my run.bat file:
[code=java]@echo off title EvoScape start javaw -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 EXIT[/code]
here the error i get
[IMG]http://i584.photobucket.com/albums/ss285/Nightmare97/34123123123123123.png[/img]
[hr]
Sorry i forgot, this belongs in client help, move please

item.title: Wont Run
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Jesus christ, the virtual machine cannot find the Jframe class in the directory it was executed from.

Read full topic

item.title: Wont Run
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

CLASSPATH:
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Path:
%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;%SYSTEMROOT%\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0;C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;;%systemroot%\system32

(this is so I can use my command prompt and JDK).

Client Run:

@echo off title Project No-Doze cd Classes "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx256m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 EXIT

I didn’t even need the x86 part like I kept hearing about before, but maybe try it, I coloured it red just in case, try both.

Anything else?

Read full topic

item.title: Wont Run
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

It can’t find Jframe.class.

Read full topic

item.title: Wont Run
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

My only guess is, Try this and change the paths for your own files,

[code]@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Wont Run
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

мonster:

Is your computer definitely a 32bit? I’m new to windows 7 as of yesterday and I got mine running first time. Would you like my environment variables and batch files to build off?

yeah sure. im positive its a 32 bit

Read full topic
